results.title: Some American sculpture
results.creator_credit: Sketches, United States Information Service and Frederick H Stein
results.brief_description: Offers a view of the work, philosophy and work habits of three modern American sculptors - Jennie Lea Knight who works with wood; George Mueller who works with steel; and, Fred Eversley who works with plastic.

results.title: Somazone (MAC & PC)
results.creator_credit: Cinemedia, Human Services, Quit, Legal Aid Commission of Victoria, National Asthma Campaign, Electric Alchemy, Tom Olsson and Richard Jones
results.brief_description: SomaZone is about exploring, experimenting and making choices. It’s a “Life-Simulator” which gives teenagers a chance for real decision-making. By creating a “personal body”, users can take risks and see what happens. SomaZone is a multimedia package designed to look at health, society and the law from the perspective of adolescents. Discussion notes are included in the CD in WORD format. Technical requirements: Will run on PC and MAC. PC’s need Windows 3.1 or later; 486 - 66 CPU; 6MB of free RAM; 2 x CD-ROM drive; SVGA (256 colours); 16 bit Soundblaster or compatible; Quicktime for Windows 2.1.2 (supplied). Macintosh: System 7 or later; 030 - 30MHz; 6 MB of free Ram; 2 x CD-ROM drive; 256 colours; Quicktime 2.5 supplied.

results.title: Solutions to pollution
results.brief_description: An introduction to some possible solutions to air, water, and noise pollution. Stresses conservation of resources, particularly at community level. Could be used to stimulate further in-depth discussion on some of the answers it provides. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Solutions
results.brief_description: Examples of the price we pay in our deteriorating environment for the misuse of road traffic. In contrast we see the modern railway system offering an already existing solution to our crowded island’s transport problems. A film without commentary.

results.title: Solomon and Gaenor
results.creator_credit: Sianel 4 Cymru (S4C) (Channel 4 Wales), APT Film and Television, Sheryl Crown and Paul Morrison
results.brief_description: Set against the Tredegar riots against Jewish shops in 1911, “Solomon and Gaenor” is a tragic love story of Jewish cloth merchant, Solomon (Ioan Gruffudd), and Gaenor (Nia Roberts), daughter of a struggling Welsh mining family. Solomon keeps his Jewish heritage a secret from his new love, who becomes frustrated by his inability to settle down and marry, and for the unspoken secrets between them. They are forced to re-evaluate their relationship when Gaenor falls pregnant and tensions mount between striking Welsh miners and Jewish storeholders, placing Solomon’s family in the front line. Director Paul Morrison asserts that the film is principally about the universal notion that we hide aspects of ourselves from those we love. He also manages to capture a painful chapter in the British Jewish experience. Cast also includes Sue Jones Davies, William Thomas and Mark Jones. In Welsh, Hebrew and English with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sianel 4 Cymru (S4C) (Channel 4 Wales), APT Film and Television, Sheryl Crown and Paul Morrison
results.description: Set against the Tredegar riots against Jewish shops in 1911, “Solomon and Gaenor” is a tragic love story of Jewish cloth merchant, Solomon (Ioan Gruffudd), and Gaenor (Nia Roberts), daughter of a struggling Welsh mining family. Solomon keeps his Jewish heritage a secret from his new love, who becomes frustrated by his inability to settle down and marry, and for the unspoken secrets between them. They are forced to re-evaluate their relationship when Gaenor falls pregnant and tensions mount between striking Welsh miners and Jewish storeholders, placing Solomon’s family in the front line. Director Paul Morrison asserts that the film is principally about the universal notion that we hide aspects of ourselves from those we love. He also manages to capture a painful chapter in the British Jewish experience. Cast also includes Sue Jones Davies, William Thomas and Mark Jones. In Welsh, Hebrew and English with English subtitles.
description_for_label: Set against the Tredegar riots against Jewish shops in 1911, “Solomon and Gaenor” is a tragic love story of Jewish cloth merchant, Solomon (Ioan Gruffudd), and Gaenor (Nia Roberts), daughter of a struggling Welsh mining family. Solomon keeps his Jewish heritage a secret from his new love, who becomes frustrated by his inability to settle down and marry, and for the unspoken secrets between them. They are forced to re-evaluate their relationship when Gaenor falls pregnant and tensions mount between striking Welsh miners and Jewish storeholders, placing Solomon’s family in the front line. Director Paul Morrison asserts that the film is principally about the universal notion that we hide aspects of ourselves from those we love. He also manages to capture a painful chapter in the British Jewish experience. Cast also includes Sue Jones Davies, William Thomas and Mark Jones. In Welsh, Hebrew and English with English subtitles.

results.title: Solo: behind the scenes
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, David Adams and Phil Tucker
results.brief_description: Looks at how the film “Solo” was made, discussing some of the filming and climbing problems as well as the philosophy behind the film. Mike Hoover, the climber, talks about some of the stunts, and explains why he climbs mountains - the challenge, the dangers, problems and final gratification.

results.title: Solo
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, David Adams and Mike Hoover
results.brief_description: Mike Hoover as the climber portrays the efforts and exhilarations that are experienced by the solo mountain climber. Filmed in Mexico, the United States and Canada on 21 different climbs this story explores the pleasures and dangers of mountain climbing by presenting three aspects of climbing of which the non-climber is rarely aware. These are the driving rhythm of sustained physical effort, the discovery of scenes and weathers unknown to others and the commitment to challenges which must be met alone.
